title: MIT NCAA Division III Varsity Football
description: I play on MIT's varsity football team, balancing a 20+ hour/week athletic commitment with a full-time student workload. In high school, I was a Captain and three-year starter on the Aliso Niguel High School varsity team. During the COVID-19 pandemic, I organized at-home workouts for 80+ high school teammates.

title: Delta Tau Delta Fraternity
description: As Philanthropy Chair, I started an annual charity event hosted by the fraternity known as Dunk-a-Delt, where students pay to dunk a fraternity member in a dunk tank. All proceeds go to the Against Malaria Foundation for malaria blankets. As House Manager, I am responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the fraternity house, which involves managing a $10,000+ budget for supplies and contractors.

title: National Marrow Donor Program
description: In partnership with MIT's varsity football team, I work as an organizer and promoter of an annual bone marrow donor registry drive on MIT campus every year. This drive seeks to increase the number of registered potential donors, which in turn increases the chances of finding a match for cancer patients in need of a bone marrow transplant. I train volunteers to effectively promote and effective explain the drive's mission, and collect samples from passersby. Logistically, I ensure that sign-up stations are fully staffed all hours of the event.
